oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Do you think prayer has a prayer, chief?" between 1954 and 1962
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An original political cartoon created by Jack Knox, the Nashville Banner editorial cartoonist from the mid-1940s to the early 1970s. In the foreground, Chief Justice Earl Warren and another judge look at a "No Prayer Decree" and look out the window at the Capital ("Congress"). In 1962, a landmark United State Supreme Court case (Engel v. Vitale) determined that it was unconstitutional for state officials to compose an official school prayer and require classroom recitation in public schools. The ruling did not apply to parochial or private schools in general. Forms part of the Jack Knox Political Cartoon Collection. 1 original cartoon drawing : b & w ; 14 x 19 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Warren, Earl, 1891-1974-- Caricatures and cartoons
